messages.message: What's the exact process for making a Python function available in marketplace? I followed the instructions at https://dogfood.instabase.com/docs/reference/marketplace/package_solution/ and have a directory with package.json and a src directory with my function. When I try to package, I get an error that e.map is not a function
Can you paste a link to your solution?
https://instabase.com/nihar.sheth/redaction-practice-2/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Redactor_v2-1.0.0.ibsolution
Can you add me? `vontell
done
I’d see what happens if you remove the encryption key part
there's a known issue with encryption, take that out and give it a try
took it out, same error
could it have something to do with the function I wrote itself?
e.map sounds like a JS error for me which is kinda of weird…
Try downloading the folder, turning it into a zip, renaming it to .ibsolution, uploading it, and installing it on marketplace
Hahaha is that what package does behind the scenes?
It's also what a flow binary is :joy:
Mayyybbeeeee :eyes: it does validations but that is basically it I think
It published successfully
Not sure if there are any validations to publish
I'll try using the marketplace app now
I got e.map is not a function when I tried that too, but the solution published anyway.

@Eric Han / @Kerry any idea about this error? seems like a react error.
@Nihar Sheth @Ansh Jain, if you have questions abt marketplace, feel free to use <#CNY8DEV5X|> . @Aaron Vontell I am not sure download->rename->upload is a good long term solution, we should use fix our UI/backend if there are errors. :sweat_smile:

hey! thanks for the tag, seeing this late. @Nihar Sheth can you try packing it on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) (not dogfood) and see if it packages successfully?

we fixed the encryption bug and ran a full uat - i want to make sure this is not something we shipped in the june release, but something introduced afterwards.

It's interesting because it throws off the error, but it still generates an ibsolution file and that file seems to work (this is both on dogfood and main instabase.com (http://instabase.com)) - seems to confirm that this is a front-end issue
This is all without the encryption
i see, can you add me to your repo? my id is `kerry`
thanks for reporting this!
added
I can take a look in a bit
can you add me too @Nihar Sheth `erich`

i did a quick test - i copied @Nihar Sheth’s redactor_marketplace_app folder to a different repo (https://instabase.com/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/pre-built/us-markets/sol-mkt-uat/solution-source/), and we can compile there no problem. I think this error might be related to our `get_tree_nodes` file api that is used to refresh the file ui to show new files cc @Jessica @Heymian @Eric Han
hrm it’s possible it’s another manifest of our whack-a-mole game of making sure we url encode all the strings in our APIs calls from front-end land.
Hey Nihar! Can I jump on the bandwagon to also get access? `jessica`
added you both @Jessica @Eric Han

My two theories based on this information right now are:
1. Interpreting the . as the beginning of an extension
2. Not being able to do this action at the root in instabase drive
seems to be no.2 :point_up: - i copied the folder again to my own repo at the top level and got the same error
The refresh function in the package modal was taking in a singular path versus an array. no.2 is affecting it but I'm not sure why
I'll push a fix for this; it was a problem with the value passed to the refresh function that was only a problem at the root
Also, the bad news is this has been a problem since we added this functionality, but the good news is that even though it shows an error message the functionality still works
Thanks @Jessica!
